name: The Ritz-Carlton, Washington DC

reviews.text: First of all i´d like to say that this is normally not the kind of hotels we are staying in, but due to a last minute booking the ritz carlton was nearly as cheap as other hotels were so we dicided to enjoy some luxury.
reviews.title: If you have the money it´s worth it

reviews.text: We arrived by car from NY (took us due to traffic about 6 hrs) and were happy when we finally arrived. We didn´t expect such a warm welcome. There were about 4 employees just taking care of our car and luggage. Of course everyone wanted tip, but it was nice anyway. We took valet parking as it was included in our package (first family package). The receptionist was extremly friendly, showed us on a map where everything was located and guided us to the elevator where he wished us a nice stay and sent us to our room. Exiting the elevator i suspected the worst as hearing children crying around in nearly every room. So all family first bookers are in one floor obviously. Normally we should not complain as we booked it too, but our child, me, was 17. But we were lucky, directly next to us was an empty room so we weren´t hit that hard by all the kids playing around in their rooms.
reviews.title: I wish I could give this hotel 6 Stars!

reviews.text: Arrived in our room we were suprised of the big bathroom with shower and bath tub seperated. Nice! Also the room was quite spacy with a big flat screen TV. Internet was complementary in our package and worked well. Allthough it appeard on our bill. Short talk an it was removed from it.
reviews.title: Surprised does not rank higher on TA

reviews.text: Cleaning was ok exept for one day. We came back at 3:30 pm and room was still not cleaned. Complementary breakfast was great. But we made the mistake and rushed to the nice looking buffet at our first morning.... bad decission as the waiter brought a 105$ bill. Nice one! We even asked a waiter if this would be the breakfast included for our room and he just sat us to a table, for us the sign to use the buffet.
reviews.title: Outstanding service in a lovely property

reviews.text: Valet parking in this hotel was an interesting experience... When we asked for our car to make a little tour we waited for 15 minutes. Even other clients, who came after us, got their cars. The boss of the valet parking system noticed us waiting for 15 minutes and asked us what was wrong. After that, two wrong cars were brought, when finally (after searching the key by us(!)) we got it.
reviews.title: Great people work here

reviews.text: We just spent a long weekend at this hotel and it was awesome. We came in to catch a nationals/Yankee game and the ritz was a good choice for us. I decided to upgrade to the club level and it was a great choice. Curtis made the club experience over the top. He really had a way of making us feel soo comfortable.The food presentations were great and the lounge was clean and updated. Our room was nice as well. Everyone we encountered at this hotel was great. I was a little concerned after reading some of these reviews. But as a frequent Ritz member I was confident it would be a good stay. The location is close to some good restaurants and shopping as well. We would visit this hotel again with out a doubt. The experience ranks right up there with many of the other Ritz properties we gave visited .
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

reviews.text: I happen to love this location, although one should note that it is always bustling with visiting dignitaries and various functions. The rooms are typical Ritz; food is typical Ritz; staff is... you get the picture.
reviews.title: Average Ritz...not that that's a bad thing

reviews.text: I am a former Sports Club LA member so didn't have an issue with the gym situation, but I would be (rightfully) peeved by an upcharge to use the gym at a $500+ night hotel. (Incidentally, the gym is terrible. The grumpy members are second only to the seriously grotty locker rooms, where you feel as though MRSA is lurking in every corner.) The spa, also part of Sports Club LA (not the Ritz itself) has some FABULOUS estheticians (hi, Donna!) and some truly bad seeds - you can check out the reviews of Sports Club LA itself for more info.
reviews.title: Business Engagement

reviews.text: I always have had good experiences with the staff here, although family members have reported some shortcomings (e.g., rooms given away to "more important" foreign visitors - but this is D.C.! and involuntarily moved over to the Fairmont).
reviews.title: Luxury in the District but has Competition

reviews.text: This property does run excellent AAA deals. Bottom line - this is a solid Ritz and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here on a company's dime.
reviews.title: Credit Card charged numerous times - Staff at Front Desk RUDE and Unprofessional

reviews.text: I stayed in February at the Ritz DC for a week on a business trip, the room was very clean. Front desk staff were very helpful. Food was great. Hotel location is so convenient. However there is no free Wi-Fi and there is an extra fee for using the business center. I recommend it for business trips.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Stayed here in February when I came along with my husband on a business trip. We were on the 8th floor. Rooms not huge, but very clean and the bed was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent staff

reviews.text: Easy walk to Georgetown and a good amble to the Mall and all the top museums. Front desk gave me a map and highlighted all that I should try to see in my couple days there. Was during some sort of superpac type convention, so tight security in and around the hotel.
reviews.title: Not a bad convention hotel

reviews.text: Nice bar, and they had a fabulous candy buffet in the lobby because of Valentine's Day. Thought that was a cute touch. Very expensive, but very good breakfasts.
reviews.title: Wow - the service is amazing

reviews.text: I stayed here for our company annual convention and it was a nice stay. The service was signature Ritz Carlton, but I did note that there was some needed attention to cleaning detail. Stains on carpet, dusty room and hair in tub...but then again I am super sensitive to cleanliness.
reviews.title: Stellar Hotel with a Conscience
bad experience poor service totally not up to Ritz standards
reviews.text: totally unlike any Ritz i have stayed at. missing the level of service that you come to expect from a first class hotel. will never stay at this property again

I'm never disappointed in the physical appearance and stayability of a Ritz property, but what brings me back over and over is the consistency of the service. I almost never leave a Ritz without at least one "WOW" experience. Unfortunately, I never really got close to that at this property.
reviews.title: It looks like a Ritz... but the Ritz spirit was missing....

reviews.text: Employees routinely called me by my first name, when they knew or remembered my name at all. The reservations were a challenge and much of my party did not get assigned proper rooms confirmed in the reservation. One of our party had someone's luggage in his room on the 3rd day of our stay. (I bet the people who were without their luggage were especially disappointed).
reviews.title: Wonderful Ritz Property in D.C.!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Club reservations generally insure a private, prepared check-in, but not at this property. And club only guarantees you access, NOT CLUB LEVEL. I was on the 7th floor and the club was on 9. The bell staff was totally uninspired and didn't even attempt to help when they saw members of our party wheeling luggage. If they happened to be near a door they opened it. No eye contact, no "welcome home". The cigarette disposal's were overflowing and dirty out front.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: After one day in our meeting room, we were alerted that there was a security issue with another party that was government related holding a meeting. We were forced to move our meetings to the Georgetown Ritz, which led to a 7 am departure by shuttle so we could keep our meeting schedule. When we returned that day, we saw many other clients shuttling all through the same area, leading us to believe that the "security issue" was no more than an overbooking or an attempt to please another, more important client. I guess they got a "wow" as they were accomodated and we drug ourselves back and forth on 20 minute bus rides rather than take an elevator to our room after a day of conference as we had planned more than a year ago.
reviews.title: Great New Years Stay

aka: The Ritz-Carlton, Washington Dc Hotel Washington Dc
